verses.verse: How beautiful <S%H3302><s%> are your feet <S%H6471><s%> with shoes <S%H5275><s%>, O prince <S%H5081><s%>'s daughter <S%H1323><s%>! the joints <S%H2542><s%> of your thighs <S%H3409><s%> are like jewels <S%H2481><s%>, the work <S%H4639><s%> of the hands <S%H3027><s%> of a skillful workman <S%H542><s%>.

Your navel <S%H8326><s%> is like a round <S%H5469><s%> goblet <S%H101><s%>, which wants <S%H2637><s%> not liquor <S%H4197><s%>: your belly <S%H990><s%> is like a heap <S%H6194><s%> of wheat <S%H2406><s%> set about <S%H5473><s%> with lilies <S%H7799><s%>.
Your two <S%H8147><s%> breasts <S%H7699><s%> are like two <S%H8147><s%> young <S%H6082><s%> roes <S%H6646><s%> that are twins <S%H8380><s%>.

Your neck <S%H6677><s%> is as a tower <S%H4026><s%> of ivory <S%H8127><s%>; your eyes <S%H5869><s%> like the fishpools <S%H1295><s%> in Heshbon <S%H2809><s%>, by the gate <S%H8179><s%> of Bath <S%H1337><s%>â€“rabbim: your nose <S%H639><s%> is as the tower <S%H4026><s%> of Lebanon <S%H3844><s%> which looks <S%H6822><s%> toward <S%H6440><s%> Damascus <S%H1834><s%>.

Your head <S%H7218><s%> upon you is like Carmel <S%H3760><s%>, and the hair <S%H1803><s%> of your head <S%H7218><s%> like purple <S%H713><s%>; the king <S%H4428><s%> is held <S%H631><s%> in the galleries <S%H7298><s%>.
How fair <S%H3302><s%> and how pleasant <S%H5276><s%> are you <S%H160><s%>, O love, for delights <S%H8588><s%>!
This your stature <S%H6967><s%> is like <S%H1819><s%> to a palm tree <S%H8558><s%>, and your breasts <S%H7699><s%> to clusters of grapes <S%H811><s%>.

I said <S%H559><s%>, I will go up <S%H5927><s%> to the palm tree <S%H8558><s%>, I will take hold <S%H270><s%> of the boughs <S%H5577><s%> there <S%H7699><s%>: now also your breasts shall be as clusters <S%H811><s%> of the vine <S%H1612><s%>, and the smell <S%H7381><s%> of your nose <S%H639><s%> like apples <S%H8598><s%>;

And the roof of your mouth <S%H2441><s%> like the best <S%H2896><s%> wine <S%H3196><s%> for my beloved <S%H1730><s%>, that goes <S%H1980><s%> down sweetly <S%H4339><s%>, causing the lips <S%H8193><s%> of those that are asleep <S%H3463><s%> to speak <S%H1680><s%>.
I am my beloved <S%H1730><s%>'s, and his desire is toward me <S%H8669><s%>.
Come <S%H3212><s%>, my beloved <S%H1730><s%>, let us go forth <S%H3318><s%> into the field <S%H7704><s%>; let us lodge <S%H3885><s%> in the villages <S%H3723><s%>.

Let us get up early <S%H7925><s%> to the vineyards <S%H3754><s%>; let us see <S%H7200><s%> if the vine <S%H1612><s%> flourish <S%H6524><s%>, whether the tender grape <S%H5563><s%> appear <S%H6605><s%>, and the pomegranates <S%H7416><s%> bud forth <S%H5132><s%>: there will I give <S%H5414><s%> you my loves <S%H1730><s%>.

The mandrakes <S%H1736><s%> give <S%H5414><s%> a smell <S%H7381><s%>, and at our gates <S%H6607><s%> are all manner of pleasant <S%H4022><s%> fruits <S%H2319><s%>, new and old <S%H3465><s%>, which I have laid up <S%H6845><s%> for you <S%H1730><s%>, O my beloved.
